review_title: The demise of Virgin Care cannot come soon enough - and it is inevitable
pros: The resilience and courage of colleagues forced to work for a careless, incompetent and delusional employer.
cons: The negative comments made on this site are true. I know because I have had identical experiences myself.  Virgin Care is easily the worst employer I have had in over 30 years of paid work - being ignorant, arrogant, destructive and unltimately doomed.  Don't be fooled by the occasional five start review from a head office apologist and gaslighter. Corporate staff are told to go on to sites such as these to try and counter the tidal wave of truth with obvious puff pieces that deny organisational reality. The efficient, empowering organisation they describe doesn't exist. What does exist is a hollow, mercenary shambles; a chaotic, incompetent scam; a contract-hoovering Ponzi scheme masquarding as a responsible service provider. Take it from me, working for Virgin Care is really bad for your health. Now there's irony for you! Spare yourself what I and numerous of my colleagues have suffered. Protect your physical health, self-esteem and sanity. Work for someone else! There are good health and social care providers out there desperate for staff. Find them.

Like many other reviewers on this site I was TUPE transferred into Virgincare, keen to join the company which had won the contract and which promissed so much.

Oh what a fool I was.  The reality was very different and now 19 months after the transfer it is a truly misserable place to work.  Morale is rock bottom, redundancies of ‘back office’ staff have been taking place and continue to do so during this year leading to  people feeling vulnerable.  This also impacts on already stretched front line staff.

The staff survey found that less than a quarter of people would recommend it as a place to work.  People are really working very hard to provide an excellent service but it isn’t valued by the company.  Over this past year and in particular last six months there have been a number of people leaving without other jobs to go to - that should tell anyone considering joining all they need to know about the culture and the company.

My personal advice to anyone working there is to look for another job,.

review_title: Some pro's to working here , but many cons
pros:
- Laid back work environment 
- Slightly flexible working hours ( You are able to leave 30 mins earlier on two days of the week as long as you take 30 mins for lunch, but this is drastically different to the flexible working all other departments are offered
- Not too much else really...  i do write this as a current employee of  several years, but I do feel that soon i will move elsewhere to be more appreciated , fulfilled and better compensated.  I've just got to pay off Christmas first!
cons:
-'Leads' in departments that are less experienced that some of the assistants roles under them, but are on a higher salary.  
- A 'inner circle culture' of managers looking after their own wants without caring about their staff that work hard for them everyday. There also seems to be a culture of friends being in senior positions and being treated differently to to other staff by being allowed better flexible working terms / better pay , just because they are friends with management. 
- A drastic difference in  study support being offered across departments, AP/ AR are left last as a priority whilst the management accounts/ wider accounts are encouraged to study alongside their role. 
- No clear direction on where the company is heading , the private side of things totally failed, I'm very unsure where the future lies for Virgin Care . 
- Its a very strange place to work and staff seem to be on many different employment packages, depending on if they tuped  from the NHS/ or are friendly with management. Some staff have an NHS pension who tuped, but then others have an aviva pension that only offers 3% contribution, which is horrendous in comparison. 
- Lots of staff dissappearing  after being taken to a 'meeting' and then never being seen again or replaced, leaving others left to take up their work responsibilities. 
- A total lack of morale due to all of the factors I mentioned above., but I can't blame people for being fed up after so much change over such a short time period.
